title: Walmart Says Litecoin Partnership News Release Is Fake; Retailer doesn't accept cryptocurrencies in U.S.
text:
"The press release is not authentic," said a Walmart spokeswoman. Walmart doesn't currently accept cryptocurrency as payment in the U.S., she said.

Officials at the Litecoin Foundation didn't immediately respond to requests for comment.

The price of Litecoin, one of several cryptocurrencies, briefly spiked when the fake news release and related headlines crossed news wires, including the Dow Jones News Service. Litecoin prices tumbled by about 20% after Walmart said the release was fake.

Write to Sarah Nassauer at sarah.nassauer@wsj.com

Walmart Says Litecoin Partnership News Release Is Fake
